tit.e: Owari-zukuri style (an architectural style of shrines characteristic of the Owari region)
Owari-zukuri style (an architectural style of shrines characteristic of the Owari region)
Owari-zukuri style (an architectural style of shrines characteristic of the Owari region)

sen.j: 尾張造（おわりづくり）は、日本における神社建築様式の1つ。
sen.e: Owari-zukuri style is one of the architectural styles of shrines in Japan.
Owari-zukuri style is one of the architectural styles of shrines in Japan.
Owari-zukuri style is one of the architectural styles of shrines in Japan.

sen.j: 本殿（後）、祭文殿（中）、拝殿（前）を回廊で繋いだ左右対称の建築様式で、尾張国独特の建築様式。
sen.e: Owari-zukuri style refers to a symmetrical architectural style in which Honden (main shrine) at the back, Saimonden (liturgy hall) in the middle, and Haiden (a hall of worship) at the front are connected by cloisters, which is characteristic of Owari Province.

Owari-zukuri style refers to a symmetrical architectural style in which the Honden (main shrine) at the back, the Saimonden (liturgy hall) in the middle, and the Haiden (a hall of worship) at the front are connected by cloisters, and is characteristic to Owari Province.

Owari-zukuri style refers to a symmetrical architectural style in which the Honden (main shrine) at the back, the Saimonden (liturgy hall) in the middle, and the Haiden (a hall of worship) at the front are connected by cloisters, and is characteristic to Owari Province.
